Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2012 12:11PM marywh wrote: To me, my miracle story probably would not be a miracle to any body else, but here goes. In July of this year I had a routine check-up with my onc. N o scans were scheduled at that time. I had to cancel the app. due to ins. problems and scheduled my app. for a month later. In those four short weeks I developed some small bumps along my incision. Didnt really think too much about them because they were along the scar and I thought it was just scar tissue. Went in for my app. that month and he immediatly did a biopsy on those little tiny bumps. Yep it was my bc back along with mets to the liver and possible bone and lung mets. I felt fine and would not have done any scans for a while if those bumps hadnt shown up and I had not had to reschedule that app. I t may have turned out alot worse than it is now. I truly feel like that was my miracle.

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2013 05:35PM marywh wrote: I had hand and foot syndrome really bad while on Xeloda. I found some nursing shoes that look like sneakers, but have air slits in the bottom, so you cant wear them in the rain. They are made by Scrubs and were only about 20$. I still wear them, theyve lasted almost 2 years. I got them at Shoe Show. As far as rainy days, I wear my Uggs. They're kind of hot but are the most comfy. I also found some great foot balm, called Restoration Foot Balm by the Naked Bee out of Johnson City Tenn. Believe it or not I found it at the hardware store. Great for cracking and chapped skin. Good luck, I feel for you. I know its miserable.
